item.description:
Or at least romantic music (rescheduled, previous concert snowed-out). It's a free quartet concert with NHCer pianist Alexis, titled "Conversation Among Equals: Romantic Chamber Works". Other professional musicians will play violin, viola, and cello. They'll be performing piano quartets by Schubert, Dvorak and Brahms. Bring your own date (she's taken). Barry White CDs optional.

If you're late, only come in during a break (while audience is clapping). Be sure your cell ringer is off (vibrate-only isn't good enough). It ends around 2:30pm. If you can't stay until the end just be sure to leave during a break.

POST-PARTY: After the performance feel free to say "hi" and simper & fawn over Alexis. There may well be a post-party...and there's the St. Patrick's parade!

HOST: Alexis, cell 203-747-9203. However, she won't be answering her phone starting an hour before the concert, and obviously not during it.

You can hear Alexis playing some Mozart at her site:
www.myspace.com/alexiszingalepianist

DIRECTIONS: For directions, click here. I don't know what effect the parade will have on street closings, parking, etc. It does go on Grove street, which is only 1 block from the concert! (parade route)

PARKING: Don't expect to find street parking on Audubon St. (which is a 1-way street). Whitney has street parking, if it's allowed on parade day, and there are parking garages in the area (such as on Audubon).

To go to the messageboard thread for this Event, click here
item.name: Sun 3/9 - Romance, with Alexis, part deux
